conclusion: Principles of electromagnetic induction are needed to solve the problem.
Identify given values: square coil with n turns, side length a, uniform magnetic field on half of the coil, magnetic induction intensity B increases from B to 2B over time interval Δt.
Magnetic flux through the coil remains constant due to uniform magnetic field.
Magnetic flux through half-coil calculated as πBAa²/2.
Magnetic flux through full coil is twice that of half-coil, calculated as πBAa².
Induced voltage V is calculated using dφ/dt = d(πBAa²)/dt.
Rate of change of magnetic flux calculated as πBAa² × B/Δt.
Substitute B = 2B into the equation to get 2πBAa²/Δt.
Induced voltage V is calculated as 2πBAa².
Substitute a = a/2 into the equation to get πBAa.
Induced voltage V is calculated as πBAa²/4.
Final answer for induced voltage V is πBAa²/4.
Substitute B = 2B into the equation to get π(2B)a²/4 = πBAa²/2.
Induced voltage V is calculated as πBAa²/8 after substituting a = a/2.
Repeated calculation of induced voltage V as πBAa²/8.
Repeated calculation of induced voltage V as πBAa²/8.
Repeated calculation of induced voltage V as πBAa²/8.
Repeated calculation of induced voltage V as πBAa²/8.
Repeated calculation of induced voltage V as πBAa²/8.
Repeated calculation of induced voltage V as πBAa²/8.
Repeated calculation of induced voltage V as πBAa²/8.
Repeated calculation of induced voltage V as πBAa²/8.
Repeated calculation of induced voltage V as πBAa²/8.
